title: When will the "reduce" argument in Loss function be released?
body_html:
• OS: MacOS
  • PyTorch version: torch-0.3.1
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
  • Python version: 2.7
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: None
  • GPU models and configuration: None
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): NA

It's not really a bug. I just notice that in the actual code in the repository, there is an additional argument reduce for the loss function. For example with BCELossWithLogits class, the signature is:
def __init__(self, weight=None, size_average=True, reduce=True):

However, in the released version 0.3.1, this change has not ended up in the released version yet. May I ask when will this change happen in the official release?

I solved my problem by copying and pasting code from the current github repo :) but would love to see the changes ending up in the official release.
